entry.title: Salesforce
entry.summary: Salesforce is a customer relationship management (CRM) service and also provides a complementary suite of enterprise applications focused on customer service, marketing automation, analytics, and application development.Versions: 8.0.0 P2Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ✔️ | Entitlements ❌
entry.content:
Salesforce is a customer relationship management (CRM) service and also provides a complementary suite of enterprise applications focused on customer service, marketing automation, analytics, and application development.

Versions: 8.0.0 P2

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ✔️ | Entitlements ❌

In Salesforce, the relationship between users, roles, profiles, and permission sets is critical for managing access and permissions within the platform. These elements work together to control what users can do and see in the Salesforce environment.

Users

  • Users are individuals who interact with Salesforce. They can be employees, customers, partners, or any other stakeholders.
  • Each user is associated with a Salesforce account, and they have a unique username and password to access the system.

Groups

  • Groups in Salesforce are collections of users, roles, or other groups.
  • Groups can be used to grant access to records, share files, collaborate on projects, or assign ownership of records. Types of Groups:
    • Regular Groups - Standard groups that can contain users, roles, or other groups.
    • Queue Groups - Used for assigning ownership of records in certain Salesforce objects, such as cases or leads, to a group of users.
    • Public Groups - Groups accessible to all users in the organization.
    • Private Groups - Groups with restricted access, typically only accessible to members explicitly added to the group.

Roles

  • Roles define the hierarchy within your organization. They represent a way to structure your organization's data and specify who can access or see records owned by users lower in the hierarchy.
  • Roles are used to determine the level of visibility users have to records based on their position in the organization's hierarchy.

Profiles

  • Profiles are a collection of settings and permissions that determine what a user can do within Salesforce. They act as templates for user access.
  • A profile includes settings for object and field-level security, record types, page layouts, and more.
  • Each user is assigned to a specific profile when they are created. This profile dictates the basic level of access and functionality that user has.

Permission Sets

  • Permission sets are used to extend the permissions granted by profiles. They allow administrators to grant additional permissions and access to specific users without changing their profiles.
  • Permission sets are often used to provide extra capabilities to users who need them, such as access to custom objects, fields, or specific administrative tasks.
  • Users can be assigned multiple permission sets to combine permissions from different sources.

Here's how these elements are related in Salesforce:

  • Users are associated with profiles initially. The profile determines the baseline access and permissions for each user.
  • Roles define the hierarchy within the organization and influence record-level access for users based on their position in the hierarchy.
  • Permission sets can be assigned to users to grant them additional permissions beyond what their profiles allow. Permission sets are additive, meaning they add to the permissions granted by the user's profile.
  • The combination of profiles, roles, and permission sets determines the overall access and permissions for each user in the organization.

Application​

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Application.
  3. Click on Create Application and select Other Application.
  4. Enter the details as shown below.
  5. Click Finish.

Account Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an account collector for the Salesforce application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 📘 for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on Salesforce.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Account Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details.



    Refer to Token Authentication for more information on authentication configuration.

  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from Salesforce

  7. Click Next. On the Account Data page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
Token URL/services/data/v60.0/query
Query Parameters
qSELECT Id,Name,isActive,Alias,email,username from User WHERE UserType='Standard'
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Sforce-Query-OptionsbatchSize=1000 (Query Options Header that controls page size)
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
PaginationLink
Response Mappings
AccountId$.records[*].Username
Id$.records[*].Id
IsActive$.records[*].IsActive
Email$.records[*].Email
Alias$.records[*].Alias
Name$.records[*].Name
  1. Click Next. On the Group Data page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
Token URL/services/data/v60.0/query
Query Parameters
qSELECT id,Name,Type,OwnerId FROM Group WHERE Type='Regular'
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Sforce-Query-OptionsbatchSize=1000 (Query Options Header that controls page size)
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
PaginationLink
Response Mappings
GroupId$.records[*].Name
Id$.records[*].Id
Type$.records[*].Type
OwnerId$.records[*].OwnerId
  1. Click Next. On the Account Group Membership page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
Token URL/services/data/v60.0/query
Query Parameters
qSELECT GroupId,UserOrGroupId FROM GroupMember
PaginationLink
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Sforce-Query-OptionsbatchSize=1000 (Query Options Header that controls page size)
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
PaginationLink
Response Mappings
Account Identifier$.records[*].UserOrGroupId
Group Identifier$.records[*].GroupId
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Mapping Attributes, map the user reference attribute.

  3. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Group Attributes, map the collected group attributes.

  4. Click Next. In the User Resolution Rules, map the user to account.

  5. Click Next. In the Member Account Resolution Rules, map the account.

💡 Info: This value MUST always be mapped to the Account Name for any generic REST collector.

  1. Click Next. In the Group Owner Resolution Rules, map the account.

  2. Click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Entitlement Collectors​

Profiles​

This section explains the process for configuring an entitlement collector to collect profiles and corresponding user assignments from Salesforce application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 📘 for this purpose.

Profiles
Profile

Profile is a metadata object that defines the permissions and settings that control what users can do within the organization. Each user in Salesforce is assigned a profile that determines their access level, object permissions, and user interface settings. Profiles are predefined sets of permissions that can be assigned to multiple users.

  • Profiles control permissions such as object permissions (e.g., create, read, edit, delete), field permissions, Apex class and Visualforce page access, user interface settings (e.g., tabs, apps, page layouts), and more.
  • Profiles are managed in Setup > Administration Settings > Profiles.
UserProfile

UserProfile is an object in the Salesforce schema that represents the individual user settings and configurations for a specific user. It contains information such as the user's language, locale, time zone, email preferences, and other personal settings.

  • UserProfile records are automatically created for each user in Salesforce and cannot be manually created or edited.
  • UserProfile records are used to store user-specific settings and configurations that are not controlled by profiles, such as language, locale, time zone, email preferences, etc.
  • UserProfile records can be accessed via the Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) queries but are typically managed programmatically rather than through the Salesforce UI.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as AveksaAdmin.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on Salesforce.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Entitlement Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details as shown in Step 5 of Account Collector.
  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from Salesforce.

  7. Click Next. On the App Role Data page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
Token URL/services/data/v60.0/query
Query Parameters
qSELECT id,Name,UserType,Description FROM Profile
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Sforce-Query-OptionsbatchSize=1000 (Query Options Header that controls page size)
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
PaginationLink
Response Mappings
Application Role Id$.records[*].Name
ProfileID$.records[*].Id
Description$.records[*].Description
  1. Click Next. On the App-Role Account Membership collection page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
Token URL/services/data/v60.0/query
Query Parameters
qSELECT Id,Profileid,Email,Name FROM User WHERE UserType='Standard'
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Sforce-Query-OptionsbatchSize=1000 (Query Options Header that controls page size)
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
PaginationLink
Response Mappings
Application Role Id$.records[*].ProfileId
Account Identifier$.records[*].Id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to App Role Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Account Evaluation, map the account collector to account value.

  3. Click Next and then click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Roles​

This section explains the process for configuring an entitlement collector to collect roles and corresponding user assignments from Salesforce application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 📘 for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as AveksaAdmin.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on Salesforce.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Entitlement Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details as shown in Step 5 of Account Collector.
  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from Salesforce.

  7. Click Next. On the App Role Data page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
Token URL/services/data/v60.0/query
Query Parameters
qSELECT Id,Name,ParentRoleId,RollupDescription FROM UserRole
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Sforce-Query-OptionsbatchSize=1000 (Query Options Header that controls page size)
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
PaginationLink
Response Mappings
Application Role Id$.records[*].Name
RoleId$.records[*].Id
Description$.records[*].RollupDescription
  1. Click Next. On the App-Role Account Membership collection page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
Token URL/services/data/v60.0/query
Query Parameters
qSELECT Id,UserRoleId FROM User WHERE UserRoleId != null and UserType='Standard'
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Sforce-Query-OptionsbatchSize=1000 (Query Options Header that controls page size)
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
PaginationLink
Response Mappings
Application Role Id$.records[*].UserRoleId
Account Identifier$.records[*].Id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to App Role Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Account Evaluation, map the account collector to account value.

  3. Click Next and then click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Permission Sets​

This section explains the process for configuring an entitlement collector to collect permission sets and corresponding user assignments from Salesforce application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 📘 for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as AveksaAdmin.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on Salesforce.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Entitlement Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details as shown in Step 5 of Account Collector.
  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from Salesforce.

  7. Click Next. On the App Role Data page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
Token URL/services/data/v60.0/query
Query Parameters
qSELECT Id, Label, Name, Description, IsCustom, Type FROM PermissionSet
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Sforce-Query-OptionsbatchSize=1000 (Query Options Header that controls page size)
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
PaginationLink
Response Mappings
Application Role Id$.records[*].Label
PermissionSetId$.records[*].Id
Type$.records[*].Type
Description$.records[*].Description
APIName$.records[*].Name
IsCustom$.records[*].IsCustom
  1. Click Next. On the App-Role Account Membership collection page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
Token URL/services/data/v60.0/query
Query Parameters
qSELECT Id,AssigneeId,PermissionSetGroupId,PermissionSetId FROM PermissionSetAssignment
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Sforce-Query-OptionsbatchSize=1000 (Query Options Header that controls page size)
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
PaginationLink
Response Mappings
Application Role Id$.records[*].PermissionSetId
Account Identifier$.records[*].AssigneeId
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to App Role Attributes, map the collected account attributes.
  2. Click Next. In the Account Evaluation, map the account collector to account value.

  3. Click Next and then click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Pagination​

To enable pagination for Salesforce ADC & EDC in G&L, you can utilize the following settings. The page size in Salesforce is governed by the Sforce-Query-Options request header.


Pagination Parameters
Maximum Records Per Pagedummy 1000
Pagination ModelCarry Forward Parameter
Read FromResponse Body $.['nextRecordsUrl']
Pass AsURL
Use Base URL✔️

Authentication​

Username-Password Flow​

Reference : OAuth 2.0 Username-Password Flow for Special Scenarios

OAuth 2.0 Username-Password

This authentication type is not recommenced by Salesforce.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Create or Edit a generic REST ADC that will be using Token authentication.
  3. On the Connection Details page, configure the following.
tip

Here the client_id is the the consumer key and the client_secret is the consumer secret from the connected app 📘 created in Salesforce.




Request
MethodPOST
Token URLhttps://instance.my.salesforce.com/services/oauth2/token
UsernameSalesforce user name
PasswordPassword for the user
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Content-Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded
Request Body
grant_type=password&username=${TokenUsername}&password=${TokenPassword}
&client_id=CLIENT_ID_VALUE&client_secret=CLIENT_SECRET_VALUE
Response Mappings
Response Path$.access_token
  1. Save the collector configuration & test.

Client Credentials Flow​

Reference : OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Flow for Server-to-Server Integration

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Create or Edit a generic REST ADC that will be using Token authentication.
  3. On the Connection Details page, configure the following.
tip

Here the client_id is the the consumer key and the client_secret is the consumer secret from the connected app 📘 created in Salesforce.




Request
MethodPOST
Token URLhttps://instance.my.salesforce.com/services/oauth2/token
UsernameConsumer Key
PasswordConsumer Secret
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Content-Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded
Request Body
grant_type=client_credentials&client_id=${TokenUsername}&client_secret=${TokenPassword}
Response Mappings
Response Path$.access_token
  1. Save the collector configuration & test.

References​

  • REST API Developer Guide
  • Build a Connected App for API Integration
  • Standard Objects
COL060

entry.title: Google Workspace
entry.summary: Google Workspace (formerly Google Suite) is a cloud-based suite of productivity
entry.content:
Google Workspace (formerly Google Suite) is a cloud-based suite of productivity tools that includes Gmail, Google Drive, Docs, Sheets, Slides, and more. It facilitates seamless collaboration and communication among teams, offering real-time editing, sharing, and storage of documents. Designed for business efficiency, it enhances productivity and fosters collaboration by providing a unified platform for work-related tasks.

Versions: 8.0.0 P1 8.0.0 P4

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌

Overview​

In this section, we will dive deeper into various Google Workspace objects that hold significance from an access management perspective.

Users​

  • Users are individual accounts that represent people within your organization.
  • Each user has a unique email address associated with your organization's domain (e.g., user@mycompany.com).
  • Users are granted access to various Google Workspace services based on their roles and permissions.

Groups​

  • Groups are collections of users, and they simplify communication and collaboration by allowing you to send messages and share resources with a single group email address.
  • There are different types of groups in Google Workspace:
    • Google Groups for Business: These are used for communication and collaboration within an organization.
    • Email lists (groups): These are used for sending messages to multiple users by using a single group email address.
    • Collaborative inboxes: These are groups with an associated email address where members can collaborate on emails.

Roles​

  • Roles in Google Workspace define a set of permissions that determine what actions users with that role can perform.
  • Google Workspace has predefined roles such as super admin, groups admin, user management admin, etc.
  • Roles help in delegating administrative tasks and ensuring that users have the appropriate level of access to perform their duties without exposing unnecessary permissions.

Users and Groups Users can be added to groups, allowing for easier management of permissions and sharing resources. For example, you can create a group for a project team and grant access to specific documents or folders to the entire group.

Roles and Users/Groups Roles are assigned to users or groups to define their level of access and permissions. For instance, a user can be assigned the role of an admin to manage certain aspects of Google Workspace services.

Groups and Roles Groups can be assigned specific roles to grant them certain administrative privileges. For example, a group may be given the role of a group admin, allowing its members to manage the membership and settings of that group.

Application​

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Application.
  3. Click on Create Application and select Other Application.
  4. Enter the details as shown below.
  5. Click Finish.

Account Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an account collector for the Google Workspace. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on Google Workspace.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Account Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details. Refer to OAuth2 Configuration section for configuring the authentication for this collector. API keys cannot be used for invoking Admin SDK APIs and requires OAuth or Service account credentials.

  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from Google Workspace

  7. Click Next. On the Account Data page, enter the following configurations.




    Request
    MethodGET
    URL/admin/directory/v1/users
    Query Parameters
    domainmycompany.com
    fieldsusers(id,lastLoginTime,primaryEmail,suspended,customerId,orgUnitPath),nextPageToken
    Request Headers
    Acceptapplication/json
    AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
    Response Mappings
    AccountId$.users.*.primaryEmail
    Id$.users.*.id
    IsSuspended$.users.*.suspended
    LastLoginTime$.users.*.lastLoginTime
  8. Click Next. On the Group Data page, enter the following configurations.




    Request
    MethodGET
    URL/admin/directory/v1/groups
    Query Parameters
    domainmycompany.com
    fieldsgroups(id,email,name,description),nextPageToken
    Request Headers
    Acceptapplication/json
    AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
    Response Mappings
    GroupId$.groups.*.name
    Id$.groups.*.id
    Email$.groups.*.email
    Description$.groups.*.description
  9. Click Next. On the Account Group Membership page, enter the following configurations.



    Request
    MethodGET
    URL/admin/directory/v1/groups/${Id}/members
    Query Parameters
    fieldsmembers(id),nextPageToken
    Request Headers
    Acceptapplication/json
    AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
    Response Mappings
    Account Identifier$.members.*.id
  10. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  11. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Mapping Attributes, map the user reference attribute.

  12. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Group Attributes, map the collected group attributes.

  13. Click Next. In the User Resolution Rules, map the user to account.

  14. Click Next. In the Member Account Resolution Rules, map the account.

    info

    This value MUST always be mapped to the Account Name for any generic REST collector.

  15. Click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Application Setup​

This section explains the process of setting up API access in Google Cloud Console for integration with G&L.

Steps to setup project

  1. Go to https://console.cloud.google.com and login with your administrator account.
  2. On the left hand corner, click on projects dropdown and select New Project.

  3. Provide a suitable project name and click Create.

  4. From the popup select the newly created project.
  5. Click on APIs & Services.

  6. Select Enable APIs and Services.
  7. Search and enable the following:
    • Admin SDK API

Steps to setup credentials

  1. Go to APIs dashboard https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/dashboard and click on OAuth consent screen.
  2. Select Internal User Type and click Create.

  3. Provide a suitable application name and required details and click Save and Continue.

  4. Click on Add or Remove Scopes
  5. Search and add the following:
    • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.group.readonly
    • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.user.readonly
    • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.group.member.readonly
    • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.rolemanagement.readonly
    • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.user.alias.readonly
  6. Click on Save and Continue
  7. Click on Credentials menu item.
  8. Click on Create Credentials and select OAuth Client ID.

  9. Select Application Type and provide a suitable name.

    .
  10. Specify the OAuth callback URL (https://instance.com:8443/aveksa/oauth/callback) under Authorized Redirect URIs and click Create.

  11. Copy the Client ID and Client Secret for use with G&L.

Authentication​

OAuth2​

This section explains the process of setting up OAuth2 authentication with RSA G&L REST collectors.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Create or Edit a generic REST ADC that will be using OAuth2 authentication.
  3. On the Connection Details page, configure the following.
    Request
    Client IDVALUE
    Client SecretVALUE
    Authentication URLhttps://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/v2/auth
    Access Token URLhttps://oauth2.googleapis.com/token
    Scope

    Account Collector

    https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.group.readonly https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.user.readonly https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.group.member.readonly&access_type=offline&prompt=consent

    Entitlement Collector

    https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.rolemanagement.readonly&access_type=offline&prompt=consent

    By default, refresh token is not return during the authorization flow and hence it is important to add access_type=offline and prompt=consent at the end of the scope string.

  4. Click on Get OAuth 2.0 Access Token.
  5. Click on Proceed For Authorization.

  6. Login to Google account. Click on Allow to authorize and acquire the access and refresh tokens.
  7. The below message indicates that RSA G&L has successfully acquired a token.
  8. Click Close.
  9. Save the collector configuration. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

References​

  • Directory API Overview
  • Admin SDK API, v1
  • OAuth 2.0 Playground
COL059

entry.title: MaintainX
entry.summary: MaintainX is a versatile maintenance management platform designed to streamline operations for businesses across various industries. With intuitive features for work orders, asset management, and team collaboration, MaintainX empowers organizations to efficiently track and manage maintenance tasks, enhance productivity, and ensure equipment reliability. Its user-friendly interface and mobile accessibility make it a convenient solution for modern maintenance needs.Versions: 8.0.0 P2Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌
entry.content:
MaintainX is a versatile maintenance management platform designed to streamline operations for businesses across various industries. With intuitive features for work orders, asset management, and team collaboration, MaintainX empowers organizations to efficiently track and manage maintenance tasks, enhance productivity, and ensure equipment reliability. Its user-friendly interface and mobile accessibility make it a convenient solution for modern maintenance needs.

Versions: 8.0.0 P2

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌

Application​

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Application.

  4. Enter the details as shown below.

Application Setup​

This section explains the process of setting up MaintainX for integration with G&L.

Steps

  1. Login to MaintainX dashboard https://app.getmaintainx.com/.
  2. On the bottom left hand corner, click on the user profile and click on Integrations.

  3. Click on New Key.

  4. Provide a suitable name for the integration and click on Generate Key.

  5. Copy the token and retain for use with G&L.

API Examples​

List Users​

{
    "users": [
        {
            "id": 633629,
            "firstName": "Alexander",
            "lastName": "Wright",
            "email": "alexander.wright@example.com",
            "phoneNumber": null,

        },
        {

            "email": "amelia.rodriguez@example.com",

        },
        {
            "id": 633631,

            "lastName": "Harris",
            "email": "charlotte.harris@example.com",
            "phoneNumber": null,
            "authType": "NORMAL"
        }

}

List Teams​

    "teams": [
        {
            "id": 85601,

        },

        },

entry.title: AdvicePay
entry.summary: AdvicePay is a secure online payment platform designed specifically for financial advisors. It facilitates fee-for-service transactions, ensuring compliance with industry regulations like ADV and SEC. Advisors can create custom payment schedules, invoice clients, and track payments seamlessly. AdvicePay streamlines billing processes, enabling advisors to focus more on delivering valuable financial guidance to their clients.Versions: 8.0.0 P2Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ❌ | App Roles ✔️ | Entitlements ❌
entry.content:
AdvicePay is a secure online payment platform designed specifically for financial advisors. It facilitates fee-for-service transactions, ensuring compliance with industry regulations like ADV and SEC. Advisors can create custom payment schedules, invoice clients, and track payments seamlessly. AdvicePay streamlines billing processes, enabling advisors to focus more on delivering valuable financial guidance to their clients.

Versions: 8.0.0 P2

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ❌ | App Roles ✔️ | Entitlements ❌

Overview​

Admin Roles​

  • Admin: Can do almost everything the account owner can do, including inviting clients, requesting payments, canceling invoices, and exporting transaction reports. However, Admins cannot view billing bank information, add or delete Admin and Analyst users, change the company name, or delete the account.
  • Analyst: Can only view activity on the account, such as clients, invoices, and transfers, as well as export transaction reports. Analysts cannot view billing bank information or make any changes.
  • Developer: Can read and write, as well as access API keys.

Advisor Roles​

  • Account Owner: Responsible for managing all firm settings and data, including banking information. Holds complete control over billing clients.
  • Full-Access Advisor: Granted access to view firm data, including clients of other advisors, and can manage billing for their own clients or those of other advisors. They lack authorization to enable eSignatures, alter/view banking details, or delete the account. However, they possess the capability to manage other firm-wide settings.
  • Standard Advisor: Authorized to view and manage billing for their own clients only. They are not permitted to view or control firm-wide settings.
  • Read Only Advisor: Granted login access solely for viewing payment statuses and their own clients' details. Suitable for advisors who need to monitor assigned clients and invoice activity without directly billing them.
  • No Login Advisor: Does not possess login credentials to access account activity. This option is optimal for centralized billing and assigning clients to No-Login Advisors for organizational purposes.

Application​

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Application.
  3. Click on Create Application and select Other Application.
  4. Enter the details as shown below.
  5. Click Finish.

Account Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an account collector for the AdvicePay application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 📘 for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on AdvicePay.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Account Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details.



    Refer to Token Authentication for more information on authentication configuration.

  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from AdvicePay.

  7. Click Next. On the Account Data page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URL/api/public/v1/admins (Sample Response)
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
AccountId$.items.*.id
Id$.items.*.email




Request
MethodGET
URL/api/public/v1/advisors (Sample Response)
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
AccountId$.items.*.id
Id$.items.*.email
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Mapping Attributes, map the user reference attribute.

  3. Click Next. In the User Resolution Rules, map the user to account.

  4. Click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Entitlement Collector​

Advisor Permission Types​

This section explains the process for configuring an entitlement collector to collect advisor permission types and assignments from the AdvicePay application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector for this purpose.

info

Since AdvicePay does not provide an API for listing advisor permission types, we will use a custom web service for the EDC. Refer to Custom Web Service : Advisor Permission Types for more information.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as AveksaAdmin.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on AdvicePay.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Entitlement Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details as shown in Step 5 of Account Collector. 💡 Note that the Use Base URL for all API(s) will be unchecked.
  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from AdvicePay.

  7. Click Next. On the App Role Data page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URLhttps://instance.securid.com/aveksa/custom/external_jsp/AdvicePayAdvisorRolesv1.2.jsp
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Response Mappings
ApplicationRoleId$.advisor_roles.*.role
Description$.advisor_roles.*.description
  1. Click Next. On the App-Role Account Membership collection page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URLhttps://app.advicepay.com/api/public/v1/advisors
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
Application Role Id$.items.*.roleTitle
Account Identifier$.items.*.id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to App Role Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Account Evaluation, map the account collector to account value.

  3. Click Next and then click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Admin Roles​

This section explains the process for configuring an entitlement collector to collect admin roles and assignments from the AdvicePay application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector for this purpose.

info

Since AdvicePay does not provide an API for listing admin roles, we will use a custom web service for the EDC. Refer to Custom Web Service : Admin Roles for more information.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as AveksaAdmin.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on AdvicePay.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Entitlement Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details as shown in Step 5 of Account Collector. 💡 Note that the Use Base URL for all API(s) will be unchecked.
  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from AdvicePay.

  7. Click Next. On the App Role Data page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URLhttps://instance.securid.com/aveksa/custom/external_jsp/AdvicePayAdminRolesv1.0.jsp
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Response Mappings
ApplicationRoleId$.user_roles.*.role
Description$.user_roles.*.description
  1. Click Next. On the App-Role Account Membership collection page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URLhttps://app.advicepay.com/api/public/v1/admins
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
Application Role Id$.items.*.roleTitle
Account Identifier$.items.*.id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to App Role Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Account Evaluation, map the account collector to account value.

  3. Click Next and then click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Authentication​

Token​

This section explains the process of setting up RSA G&L ADC with token authentication.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Create or Edit a generic REST ADC that will be using Token authentication.
  3. On the Connection Details page, configure the following.



Request
MethodPOST
Token URLhttps://app.advicepay.com/oauth2/access_token
UsernameClient ID
PasswordClient Secret
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Content-Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded
Request Body
grant_type=client_credentials&client_id=${TokenUsername}&client_secret=${TokenPassword}
Response Mappings
Response Path$.access_token
  1. Save the collector configuration & test.

Custom Web Service​

Advisor Permission Types​

Since AdvicePay does not provide an API for listing advisor permission types, we will use a custom JSP that will publish this as web service.

Steps

  1. Open a text editor and save the contents below as AdvicePayAdvisorRolesv1.2.jsp
<%@ page language="java" contentType="application/json" %>

<%
String jsonData = "{\n" +
    "  \"advisor_roles\": [\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"role\": \"Managing Advisor\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Can see office-wide data.\"\n" +
    "    },\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"role\": \"Full-access Advisor\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Can see firm-wide data and update firm settings.\"\n" +
    "    },\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"role\": \"Advisor\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Gives full access to AdvicePay.\"\n" +
    "    },\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"role\": \"Read-only Advisor\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Gives login access but no power to invoice clients.\"\n" +
    "    },\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"role\": \"No-login Advisor\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Gives no login, and is completely managed by home office.\"\n" +
    "    }\n" +
    "  ]\n" +
    "}";
%>

<%
    response.setContentType("application/json");
    out.print(jsonData);
%>
  1. Login to RSA G&L console as AveksaAdmin.
  2. Navigate to Admin > User Interface.
  3. Click on Files.
  4. Select External JSP Pages and click on Upload.
  5. Select the AdvicePayAdvisorRolesv1.2.jsp and click OK.
  6. Verify by accessing this URL in the browser https://instance.securid.com/aveksa/custom/external_jsp/AdvicePayAdvisorRolesv1.2.jsp

Admin Roles​

Since AdvicePay does not provide an API for listing admin roles, we will use a custom JSP that will publish this as web service. Use the code provided below to create AdvicePayAdminRolesv1.0.jsp and upload it similar to Advisor Permission Types

<%@ page language="java" contentType="application/json" %>

<%
String jsonData = "{\n" +
    "  \"user_roles\": [\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"role\": \"Admin\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Admin gives the same access and functionality as the parent user.\"\n" +
    "    },\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"role\": \"Analyst\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Analyst gives read-only access to the parent user's account.\"\n" +
    "    },\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"role\": \"Developer\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Can read and write, as well as access API keys.\"\n" +
    "    }\n" +
    "  ]\n" +
    "}";
%>

<%
    response.setContentType("application/json");
    out.print(jsonData);
%>

entry.summary: Sigma Business Intelligence offers powerful analytics solutions, empowering businesses with actionable insights. With a focus on user-friendly tools and real-time analytics, Sigma BI accelerates growth and enhances competitiveness in today's dynamic market landscape.Versions: 8.0.0 P2Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌
entry.content:
Sigma Business Intelligence offers powerful analytics solutions, empowering businesses with actionable insights. Through intuitive interfaces and robust data integration, Sigma BI transforms complex data into strategic decisions. With a focus on user-friendly tools and real-time analytics, Sigma BI accelerates growth and enhances competitiveness in today's dynamic market landscape.

Versions: 8.0.0 P2

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌

Application​

This section explains the process for configuring an account collector for the Sigma application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 📘 for this purpose.

    Refer to Token Authentication for more information on authentication configuration.

AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}

Account Identifier$.entries.*.userId
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Mapping Attributes, map the user reference attribute.

  3. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Group Attributes, map the collected group attributes.

  4. Click Next. In the User Resolution Rules, map the user to account.

  5. Click Next. In the Member Account Resolution Rules, map the account.

  6. Click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Authentication​

Token​

This section explains the process of setting up RSA G&L ADC with token authentication.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.

Response Mappings

  1. Save the collector configuration & test.

Application Setup​

This section explains the process of setting up Sigma for integration with G&L.

Steps

  1. Login to Sigma dashboard https://app.sigmacomputing.com/ as administrator.
  2. On the right hand corner, click on the user profile and click on Administration.

  3. Select Developer Access and click on Create new.

  4. Select the REST API option under privileges and provide a suitable name for the integration. Select te appropriate user for the integration owner.

  5. Click on Create and copy the Client ID and Client Secret and retain for use with G&L.

entry.title: Bonusly
entry.summary: Bonusly is a recognition and rewards platform that fosters employee engagement by allowing peers to give and receive micro-bonuses for excellent work. Its intuitive interface and integration with popular workplace tools make it easy for teams to appreciate each other's efforts, boosting morale and productivity.Versions: 8.0.0 P2Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ❌ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌
entry.content:
Bonusly is a recognition and rewards platform that fosters employee engagement by allowing peers to give and receive micro-bonuses for excellent work. Its intuitive interface and integration with popular workplace tools make it easy for teams to appreciate each other's efforts, boosting morale and productivity.

Versions: 8.0.0 P2

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ❌ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌

Application​

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Application.
  3. Click on Create Application and select Other Application.
  4. Enter the details as shown below.
  5. Click Finish.

Account Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an account collector for the Bonusly application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 📘 for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on Bonusly.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Account Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details.



  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from Bonusly.

  7. Click Next. On the Account Data page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URL/users (Sample Response)
Query Parameters
include_archivedtrue
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
AccountId$.result.*.username
Id$.result.*.id
Email$.result.*.email
UniqueID$.result.*.external_unique_id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Mapping Attributes, map the user reference attribute.

  3. Click Next. In the User Resolution Rules, map the user to account.

  4. Click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Entitlement Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an entitlement collector to collect site roles and assignments from the Bonusly application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector for this purpose.

info

Since Bonusly does not provide an API for listing user modes, we will use a custom web service for the EDC. Refer to Custom Web Service : User Modes for more information.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as AveksaAdmin.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on Bonusly.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Entitlement Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details as shown in Step 5 of Account Collector. 💡 Note that the Use Base URL for all API(s) will be unchecked.
  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from Bonusly.

  7. Click Next. On the App Role Data page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URLhttps://instance.securid.com/aveksa/custom/external_jsp/BonuslyUserModesv2.jsp
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Response Mappings
ApplicationRoleId$.user_modes.*.userMode
Description$.user_modes.*.description
  1. Click Next. On the App-Role Account Membership collection page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URLhttps://bonus.ly/api/v1/users
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
Application Role Id$.result.*.user_mode
Account Identifier$.result.*.id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to App Role Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Account Evaluation, map the account collector to account value.

  3. Click Next and then click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Application Setup​

This section explains the process of setting up Bonusly for integration with G&L.

Steps

  1. Login to Bonusly API dashboard https://bonus.ly/api.
  2. Click on Create New API Access Token.

  3. Provide a suitable label and click on Create Api key.

  4. The API key will be shown on the right hand corner for a few seconds.

  5. Copy the token and retain for use with G&L.

Custom Web Service​

User Modes​

Since Bonusly does not provide an API for listing user modes, we will use a custom JSP that will publish this as web service.

Steps

  1. Open a text editor and save the contents below as BonuslyUserModesv2.jsp.
<%@ page language="java" contentType="application/json" %>
<%
String jsonData = "{\n" +
    "  \"user_modes\": [\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"userMode\": \"normal\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Normal users are the standard users of Bonusly. They can give bonuses to others, receive bonuses, and engage with other features of the platform like commenting and redeeming bonuses. This mode is suitable for regular employees who actively participate in recognizing their peers.\"\n" +
    "    },\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"userMode\": \"benefactor\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Benefactors have the ability to give bonuses to others but do not receive bonuses themselves. This mode is often used for administrators, managers, or executives who want to incentivize and reward their team members but do not wish to receive bonuses in return.\"\n" +
    "    },\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"userMode\": \"receiver\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Receivers can only receive bonuses from others but cannot give bonuses themselves. This mode is typically assigned to contractors, interns, or temporary staff who may not have the authority or need to give bonuses but can still be recognized and rewarded by their colleagues.\"\n" +
    "    },\n" +
    "    {\n" +
    "      \"userMode\": \"observer\",\n" +
    "      \"description\": \"Observers have limited interaction with the platform and can only view bonus activity without the ability to give or receive bonuses. This mode is useful for stakeholders, auditors, or other parties who need to monitor bonus activity within the organization without actively participating in the recognition process.\"\n" +
    "    }\n" +
    "  ]\n" +
    "}";
%>

<%
    response.setContentType("application/json");
    out.print(jsonData);
%>
  1. Login to RSA G&L console as AveksaAdmin.
  2. Navigate to Admin > User Interface.
  3. Click on Files.
  4. Select External JSP Pages and click on Upload.
  5. Select the BonuslyUserModesv2.jsp and click OK.
  6. Verify by accessing this URL in the browser https://instance.securid.com/aveksa/custom/external_jsp/BonuslyUserModesv2.jsp

API Examples​

    "result": [

entry.title: HubSpot
entry.summary: HubSpot is a leading CRM platform that offers marketing, sales, and customer service tools to help businesses grow. It provides solutions for email marketing, lead generation, social media management, and more, all integrated into one platform. HubSpot's user-friendly interface and robust analytics make it a popular choice for companies seeking to streamline their customer relationship management efforts.Versions: 8.0.0 P2Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌
entry.content:
HubSpot is a leading CRM platform that offers marketing, sales, and customer service tools to help businesses grow. It provides solutions for email marketing, lead generation, social media management, and more, all integrated into one platform. HubSpot's user-friendly interface and robust analytics make it a popular choice for companies seeking to streamline their customer relationship management efforts.

Versions: 8.0.0 P2

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌

Application​

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Application.
  3. Click on Create Application and select Other Application.
  4. Enter the details as shown below.
  5. Click Finish.

Account Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an account collector for the HubSpot application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 📘 for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on HubSpot.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Account Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details.



  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from HubSpot

  7. Click Next. On the Account Data page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
URL/crm/v3/owners (Sample Response)
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
AccountId$.results[*].email
Id$.results[*].id
  1. Click Next. On the Group Data page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
URL/settings/v3/users/teams (Sample Response)
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
GroupId$.results.*.name
Id$.results.*.id
  1. Click Next. On the Account Group Membership page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
URL/crm/v3/owners (Sample Response)
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
Account Identifier$.results[*].id
Group Identifier$.results[*].teams[*].id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Mapping Attributes, map the user reference attribute.

  3. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Group Attributes, map the collected group attributes.

  4. Click Next. In the User Resolution Rules, map the user to account.

  5. Click Next. In the Member Account Resolution Rules, map the account.

  6. Click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Pagination​

To enable pagination for HubSpot ADC and EDC in G&L, you can utilize the following settings:

Pagination Parameters
Maximum Records Per Page
Parameter KeyParameter Value
limit100
Read From
Parameter KeyParameter Value
Response Body$.paging.next.link
Pass As
Parameter KeyParameter Value
URL-

Application Setup​

This section explains the process of setting up HubSpot for integration with G&L.

Steps

  1. Login to HubSpot https://app.hubspot.com/.
  2. On the right hand corner, click on Profile & Preferences.

  3. Click on Private apps under Integrations.
  4. Click on Create a private app.

  5. Provide a suitable application name.

  6. Click on Scopes tab and provide the the following scopes.
    • crm.objects.users.read
    • settings.users.teams.read
    • settings.users.read
    • crm.objects.owners.read
  7. Click Create app.

  8. Click on Continue creating.

  9. Copy the token and retain for use with G&L.

entry.title: TalentLMS
entry.summary: TalentLMS is a user-friendly learning management system designed for businesses and educational institutions. With intuitive course creation tools, customizable learning paths, and robust tracking features, it enables organizations to deliver effective training to employees, customers, and partners. Its cloud-based platform offers scalability, ease of use, and comprehensive reporting, making it an ideal solution for modern training needs.Versions: 8.0.0 P2Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌
entry.content:
TalentLMS is a user-friendly learning management system designed for businesses and educational institutions. With intuitive course creation tools, customizable learning paths, and robust tracking features, it enables organizations to deliver effective training to employees, customers, and partners. Its cloud-based platform offers scalability, ease of use, and comprehensive reporting, making it an ideal solution for modern training needs.

Versions: 8.0.0 P2

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌

Application​

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Application.
  3. Click on Create Application and select Other Application.
  4. Enter the details as shown below.
  5. Click Finish.

Account Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an account collector for the TalentLMS application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 📘 for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on TalentLMS.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Account Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details.



  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from TalentLMS

  7. Click Next. On the Account Data page, enter the following configurations.



info

This is the only API in TalentLMS that supports pagination

Request
MethodGET
URL/api/v1/users (Sample Response)
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Response Mappings
AccountId$.*.login
Id$.*.id
Email$.*.email
Status$.*.status
  1. Click Next. On the Group Data page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
URL/api/v1/groups (Sample Response)
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Response Mappings
GroupId$.*.name
Id$.*.id
Description$.*.description
Key$.*.key
Owner$.*.owner_id
  1. Click Next. On the Account Group Membership page, enter the following configurations.


Request
MethodGET
URL/api/v1/groups/id:${Id} (Sample Response)
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Response Mappings
Account Identifier$.users.*.id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Mapping Attributes, map the user reference attribute.

  3. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Group Attributes, map the collected group attributes.

  4. Click Next. In the User Resolution Rules, map the user to account.

  5. Click Next. In the Member Account Resolution Rules, map the account.

💡 Info: This value MUST always be mapped to the Account Name for any generic REST collector.

  1. Click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Application Setup​

This section explains the process of setting up TalentLMS for integration with G&L.

Steps

  1. Login to TalentLMS https://instance.talentlms.com/
  2. Click on Go To and select Account & Settings.

  3. Under Security check the Enable API.

  4. Copy the token and retain for use with G&L.

entry.title: Notion
entry.summary: Notion is a versatile productivity tool offering note-taking, project management, and collaboration features. Its customizable workspace allows users to organize tasks, documents, and databases efficiently. With seamless integration across platforms, Notion enhances team collaboration and individual productivity, making it a popular choice for personal and professional use.Versions: 8.0.0 P2Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌
entry.content:
Notion is a versatile productivity tool offering note-taking, project management, and collaboration features. Its customizable workspace allows users to organize tasks, documents, and databases efficiently. With seamless integration across platforms, Notion enhances team collaboration and individual productivity, making it a popular choice for personal and professional use.

Versions: 8.0.0 P2

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌

Application​

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Application.
  3. Click on Create Application and select Other Application.
  4. Enter the details as shown below.
  5. Click Finish.

Account Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an account collector for the Notion application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 📘 for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on Notion.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Account Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details.



  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from Notion.

  7. Click Next. On the Account Data page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URL/Users (Sample Response)
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
AccountId$.Resources.*.userName
Id$.Resources.*.id
Email$.Resources.*.emails.*.value
IsActive$.Resources.*.active
  1. Click Next. On the Group Data page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URL/Groups (Sample Response)
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
GroupId$.Resources.*.displayName
Id$.Resources.*.id
  1. Click Next. On the Account Group Membership page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URL/Groups (Sample Response)
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
Account Identifier$.Resources.*.members.*.value
Group Identifier$.Resources.*.id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Mapping Attributes, map the user reference attribute.

  3. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Group Attributes, map the collected group attributes.

  4. Click Next. In the User Resolution Rules, map the user to account.

  5. Click Next. In the Member Account Resolution Rules, map the account.

💡 Info: This value MUST always be mapped to the Account Name for any generic REST collector.

  1. Click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Application Setup​

This section explains the process of setting up Notion for integration with G&L.

Steps

  1. Login to Notion https://www.notion.so/.
  2. Click on Settings and members.

  3. Click on Identity & provisioning under Integrations.

  4. Click on Add token.
  5. Copy the token and retain for use with G&L.

entry.title: Capsule CRM
entry.summary: Capsule CRM is a user-friendly customer relationship management system designed
entry.content:
Capsule CRM is a user-friendly customer relationship management system designed for small businesses. It streamlines contact management, tracks interactions, and centralizes communication, fostering efficient collaboration. With a clean interface and customizable features, Capsule CRM helps businesses stay organized and build stronger relationships with their clients.

Versions: 8.0.0

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌

Application​

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Application.
  3. Click on Create Application and select Other Application.
  4. Enter the details as shown below.
  5. Click Finish.

Account Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an account collector for the Capsule CRM application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on Capsule CRM.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Account Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details. This article will use Token based authentication to invoke REST APIs.

  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from Capsule CRM

  7. Click Next. On the Account Data page, enter the following configurations.




    Request
    MethodGET
    URL/api/v2/parties
    Request Headers
    Acceptapplication/json
    AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
    Response Mappings
    AccountId$.parties.*.emailAddresses.*.address
    Id$.parties.*.owner.id
    UserName$.parties.*.owner.username
    IsDeleted$.parties.*.owner.deleted
  8. Click Next. On the Group Data page, enter the following configurations.




    Request
    MethodGET
    URL/api/v2/teams
    Request Headers
    Acceptapplication/json
    AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
    Response Mappings
    GroupId$.teams.*.name
    Id$.teams.*.id
    Description$.teams.*.description
  9. Click Next. On the Account Group Membership page, enter the following configurations.




    Request
    MethodGET
    URL/api/v2/teams
    Query Parameters
    embedmemberships
    Request Headers
    Acceptapplication/json
    AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
    Response Mappings
    Account Identifier$.teams.*.memberships.*.user.id
    Group Identifier$.teams.*.id
  10. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  11. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Mapping Attributes, map the user reference attribute.

  12. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Group Attributes, map the collected group attributes.

  13. Click Next. In the User Resolution Rules, map the user to account.

  14. Click Next. In the Member Account Resolution Rules, map the account attribute.


    💡 Info: This value MUST always be mapped to the Account Name for any generic REST collector.
  15. Click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Application Setup​

This section explains the process of setting up token access in Capsule CRM for integration with G&L.

Steps

  1. Login to Capsule CRM console https://instance.capsulecrm.com/.
  2. On the right hand top corner, click on profile and select My Preferences.

  3. Click on API Authentication Tokens.

  4. Click on Generate First API Token or Generate New API Token option.
  5. Provide a suitable description and select the Read information from your Capsule account scope for the token. Click Generate Token.

  6. Note the token value for use in collector configurations.

References​

  • Capsule API Documentation
  • Authentication
COL051

entry.title: Aha!
entry.summary: Aha! is a product roadmap software that helps teams and companies set product strategy, prioritize features, and manage development projects. It enables collaborative planning and communication, allowing teams to align their efforts and track progress toward goals. Aha! streamlines the process of bringing products to market by providing a centralized platform for ideation, planning, and execution, enhancing overall productivity and innovation.Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌
entry.content:
Aha! is a product roadmap software that helps teams and companies set product strategy, prioritize features, and manage development projects. It enables collaborative planning and communication, allowing teams to align their efforts and track progress toward goals. Aha! streamlines the process of bringing products to market by providing a centralized platform for ideation, planning, and execution, enhancing overall productivity and innovation.

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ❌ | Entitlements ❌

Users in Aha! represent individuals who are part of your organization and interact with the platform. Each user has their own role and permissions, which determine their level of access and the actions they can perform within Aha!. Users can be product managers, designers, developers, stakeholders, and more.

Products in Aha! represent the offerings that your company is developing and managing. A product can be a software application, a physical product, a service, or any other offering. Products are the core entities around which you plan, track features, set strategies, and manage roadmaps.

Teams in Aha! refer to groups of users who collaborate on specific products or projects. Teams are designed to facilitate efficient cross-functional work and alignment. A team might consist of product managers, developers, designers, marketers, and other roles relevant to the product's development and success.

The relationship between these elements can be summarized as follows:

⚫ Users and Products: Users are associated with specific products within Aha!. This association allows users to contribute to the planning, development, and management of a particular product. Users can view, edit, and comment on features, epics, releases, and other components related to the product they are assigned to.

⚫ Teams and Products: Teams are often linked to specific products as well. This association defines the group of users who collaborate on that product's roadmap, features, and development. Teams can be organized around functional areas, such as engineering, design, marketing, and more.

Application​

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Application.
  3. Click on Create Application and select Other Application.
  4. Enter the details as shown below.
  5. Click Finish.

Account Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an account collector for the Aha! application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 1 for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on Aha!.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Account Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details. This article will use API key based authentication to invoke REST APIs. Refer to OAuth2 Configuration section to use the OAuth based authentication.

  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from Aha!

  7. Click Next. On the Account Data page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URL/users
Query Parameters
fieldsid,email,enabled
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
AccountId$.users.*.email
Id$.users.*.id
IsEnabled$.users.*.enabled
  1. Click Next. On the Group Data page, enter the following configurations.




Request
MethodGET
URL/products
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
GroupId$.products.*.name
Id$.products.*.id
IsProductLine$.products.*.product_line
Type$.products.*.workspace_type
  1. Click Next. On the Account Group Membership page, enter the following configurations.




Request
MethodGET
URL/products/${Id}/users
Query Parameters
fieldsid
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
Account Identifier$.project_users.*.user.id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Mapping Attributes, map the user reference attribute.

  3. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Group Attributes, map the collected group attributes.

  4. Click Next. In the User Resolution Rules, map the user to account.

  5. Click Next. In the Member Account Resolution Rules, map the account attribute.

  6. Click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Application Setup​

This section explains the process of setting up Aha! for integration with G&L. Aha! API calls require application key and API key for most invocations.

Steps

  1. Login to Aha! console https://instance.aha.io.
  2. Navigate to Settings > Personal > Developer.
  3. Click on the OAuth applications tab.
  4. Click egister OAuth application.
    • Name your new application.
    • Provide a Redirect URI in the following format https://instance/aveksa/oauth/callback where instance is the DNS for your G&L instance.
  5. Click Create to register your OAuth application.
  6. Note the Client ID and Client Secret fields for use in the next step.

Authentication​

OAuth2​

This section explains the process of setting up RSA G&L ADC and EDC to acquire the OAuth2 token dynamically from Aha!.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Create or Edit a generic REST ADC that will be using OAuth2 authentication.
  3. On the Connection Details page, configure the following.
Request
Client IDCLIENT_ID
Client SecretCLIENT_SECRET
Authentication URLhttps://instance.aha.io/oauth/authorize
Access Token URLhttps://instance.aha.io/oauth/token
Scope
  1. Click on Get OAuth 2.0 Access Token.
  2. Click on Proceed For Authorization.

  3. Login to DocuSign account.

  4. The below message indicates that RSA G&L has successfully acquired a token.

caution

The message indicates that Aha! did not return a refresh token, which is required to ensure a new authorization token is automatically acquired by G&L when the current token expires. This would mean the collector needs to be authorized every time it runs (unless the token is valid).

  1. Click Close.
  2. Save the collector configuration. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.
COL044

Footnotes​

  1. Aha! REST API ↩

entry.title: Genesys Cloud
entry.summary: Genesys Cloud, formerly known as "Interactive Intelligence PureCloud," is a robust cloud-based customer experience platform. It offers a wide range of features, including seamless communication, AI-driven insights, and scalable contact center solutions. With its omnichannel support, automation capabilities, and comprehensive analytics, Genesys Cloud enhances customer interactions, streamlines operations, and improves overall customer satisfaction.Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ✔️ | Entitlements ❌
entry.content:
Genesys Cloud, formerly known as "Interactive Intelligence PureCloud," is a robust cloud-based customer experience platform. It offers a wide range of features, including seamless communication, AI-driven insights, and scalable contact center solutions. With its omnichannel support, automation capabilities, and comprehensive analytics, Genesys Cloud enhances customer interactions, streamlines operations, and improves overall customer satisfaction.

Identities ❌ | Accounts ✔️ | Groups ✔️ | App Roles ✔️ | Entitlements ❌

Application​

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Application.

  4. Enter the details as shown below.
  5. Click Finish.

Account Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an account collector for the Genesys Cloud application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 1 for this purpose.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to Resources > Applications.
  3. Click on Genesys Cloud.
  4. Navigate to Collectors tab and click on Create Account Collector. Enter the details as shown below.

  5. Click Next and enter the connection details.



    Refer to Token Authentication for more information on authentication configuration.

  6. Click Next. Select the data types that the collector will be collecting from Genesys Cloud

  7. Click Next. On the Account Data page, enter the following configurations.



Request
MethodGET
URL/users
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
AccountId$.entities.*.email
Id$.entities.*.id
Status$.entities.*.state
UserName$.entities.*.username
  1. Click Next. On the Group Data page, enter the following configurations.

MethodGET
URL/groups

  1. Click Next. On the Account Group Membership page, enter the following configurations.

URL/groups/${Id}/members
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
Account Identifier$.entities.*.id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Account Mapping Attributes, map the user reference attribute.

  3. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to Group Attributes, map the collected group attributes.

  4. Click Next. In the User Resolution Rules, map the user to account.

  5. Click Next. In the Member Account Resolution Rules, map the account.

💡 Info: This value MUST always be mapped to the Account Name for any generic REST collector.

  1. Click Next. In the Group Owner Resolution Rules, map the owner to user.

  2. Click Finish. Use the Test function to make sure the configurations are accurate.

Entitlement Collector​

This section explains the process for configuring an entitlement collector to collect roles and assignments from the Genesys Cloud application. We will use the RSA G&L Generic REST collector 1 for this purpose.

URL/authorization/roles

Id$.entities.*.id
Description$.entities.*.description
  1. Click Next. On the App-Role Account Membership collection page, enter the following configurations.

Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
AuthorizationBearer ${AuthenticationToken}
Response Mappings
Account Identifier$.entities.*.id
  1. Click Next. In the Map Collector Attributes to App Role Attributes, map the collected account attributes.

  2. Click Next. In the Account Evaluation, map the account collector to account value.

Application Setup​

This section explains the process of setting up Genesys Cloud for integration with G&L. Genesys Cloud API calls require application key and API key for most invocations.

  5. Copy the key value. We will refer to this as APPLICATION_KEY

  6. Click on Edit next to Scope. Select the scopes as shown below.

Steps

  1. Login to RSA G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Create or Edit a generic REST ADC that will be using Token authentication.
  3. On the Connection Details page, configure the following.



Request
MethodPOST
Token URLhttps://login.mypurecloud.com/oauth/token
UsernameClient ID
PasswordClient Secret
Request Headers
Acceptapplication/json
Content-Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded
Request Body
grant_type=client_credentials&client_id=${TokenUsername}&client_secret=${TokenPassword}
Response Mappings
Response Path$.access_token
  1. Save the collector configuration & test.
